Detailed Description

A basic OBEX FTP server for the root file system (RFS).

This class implements the abstract OBEX FTP interface provided by the class ObexFtpServer for the root file system (RFS).

See also:
ObexFtpServer

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RfsObexFtpServer::RfsObexFtpServer (   ) 
 

Default constructor.

Default-constructed instances must be initialized using Init() before using them the first time.

RfsObexFtpServer::RfsObexFtpServer (  ExecutionContext *  ctx_ptr,
const Path &  root_path
) 
 

Constructor. Constructs a usable object instance.

Intended to be used with dynamically allocated objects (new).

Parameters:
ctx_ptr Execution context to be used by the server. All notification methods (protected: On.....()) will be called from this context. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the currently active context, which must be valid at construction the time.
root_path Root path of the server.

const Path &  root_path
)  [virtual]
 

Initializes a default-constructed object.

Parameters:
ctx_ptr Execution context in which the server is to be run. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the current execution context. In the latter case, the current context must be valid when Init() is called.
root_path Root path of the server.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnBind (  const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
ObexResult  result
)  [virtual]
 

Indicates binding of a transport channel to the server.

Parameters:
addr_ptr Smart pointer to OBEX address that was attempted to bind.
result Either tells that the bind operation was successful or provides error information.

Reimplemented from ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnConnect (  const ObexHeaderList &  headers,
UINT8  flags
)  [virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming CONNECT request.

When a TARGET was specified as part of the server's OBEX URL it will accept only CONNECT requests with a matching TARGET header. Therefore this does not need to be checked by application SW. When the server was opened specifying a TARGET, a CONNECTION ID is assigned and the pre-build response will contain the following headers: CONNECTION_ID=<set_by_server>}, TARGET=<client's WHO>, WHO=<server's TARGET>. In order to continue the ongoing operation, the request has to be either accepted or rejected. To accept the request AcceptConnectRequest(), to reject the request RejectConnectRequest(resp_code) must be called.

Parameters:
headers Header list which contains the headers of the CONNECT request sent by the remote client, for example TARGET and WHO.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnDeleteObject (  const WString &  current_folder,
const WString &  object
)  [virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming object delete request.

When this method is called, the client requests to delete an object in the current directory. In order to continue the ongoing operation, the request has to be either accepted or rejected. To accept this request the method AcceptDeleteObjectRequest() must be called, to reject the request the method RejectDeleteObjectRequest() has to be invoked.

Parameters:
current_folder The current folder (absolute, e.g. "/UserData/MyMusic/").
object The name of the object the client requests to be deleted in the current folder. Note: This object name can refer either to a file or folder.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnDisconnected (  ObexResult  result  )  [virtual]
 

Indicates that the current client has disconnected.

When the method is called, the client has (or has been) disconnected and the server should release any temporary resources and reset itself to a virgin state suitable for accepting a new client connection.

Parameters:
result ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' when the connection was disconnected using a proper OBEX DISCONNECT request, 'FALSE' when a spontaneous disconnection occurred. Check the error code then to obtain more detailed information.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnFilePull (  const WString &  current_folder,
const WString &  filename
)  [virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming file pull request.

When this method is called, the client requests to pull a file from the current directory. In order to continue the ongoing operation, the request has to be either accepted or rejected. To accept this request the method AcceptFilePullRequest() must be called, to reject the request the method RejectFilePullRequest() has to be invoked.

Parameters:
current_folder The current folder (absolute, e.g "/UserData/MyMusic/").
filename The file name of the file the client requests to pull from the current folder.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnFilePullRequestCompleted (  ObexResult  result  )  [virtual]
 

Indicates the completion of a file pull operation.

When an incoming file pull request was accept before by calling AcceptFilePullRequest(...) this method will be invoked later on when the file pull operation has finished.

Parameters:
result ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' when the current operation was completed successfully, 'FALSE' otherwise.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnFilePush (  const WString &  current_folder,
const WString &  filename,
UINT32  size
)  [virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming file push request.

When this method is called, the client requests to push a file to the current directory. In order to continue the ongoing operation, the request has to be either accepted or rejected. To accept this request the method AcceptFilePushRequest() must be called, to reject the request the method RejectFilePushRequest() has to be invoked.

Parameters:
current_folder The current folder (absolute, e.g "/UserData/MyMusic/").
filename The file name of the file the client requests to push to the current folder.
size Size of the whole file to be pushed as read from the OBEX LENGTH header. If the size equals '0', it is not yet known.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnFilePushRequestCompleted (  ObexResult  result  )  [virtual]
 

Indicates the completion of a file push operation.

When a incoming file push request was accept before by calling AcceptFilePushRequest(...) this method will be invoked later on when the file push operation has finished.

Parameters:
result ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' when the current operation was completed successfully, 'FALSE' otherwise.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnGetFolderListing (  const WString &  current_folder  )  [virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming folder listing request.

When this method is called, the client requests the folder listing of the current folder. In order to continue the ongoing operation, the request has to be either accepted or rejected. To accept this request the method AcceptFolderListingRequest() has to be invoked. To reject this folder listing request RejectFolderListingRequest(resp_code) has to be called.

Parameters:
current_folder The current folder (absolute, e.g "/UserData/MyMusic/") the client requests the folder listing of.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnProvideFolderListingEntries (  const WString &  current_folder  )  [virtual]
 

Indicates that folder entries have to be provided now.

This method is invoked by the server to indicate that the server is now ready to transfer the the requested folder listing to the client and that the folder listing entries have to be provided now. In order to continue the ongoing operation, the folder listing entries have to be provided by calling ProvideFolderListingEntry(...) for each entry and by finally calling ProvideFolderListingEntriesFinished() when all entries have been provided.

Parameters:
current_folder The current folder (absolute, e.g "/UserData/MyMusic/") the client requests the folder listing of.

Implements ObexFtpServer.

void RfsObexFtpServer::OnSetCurrentFolder (  const WString &  current_folder,
const WString &  new_current_folder,
BOOLEAN  create
)  [virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming current-folder change request.

When this method is called, the client requests a change of the current folder. The current folder and the requested current folder are passed to this method. In order to continue the ongoing operation, the request has to be either accepted or rejected. To accept this request the method AcceptSetCurrentFolderRequest() has to be invoked, to reject the folder change request the method RejectFolderListingRequest(resp_code) has to be invoked.

Parameters:
current_folder The current folder (absolute, e.g "/UserData/MyMusic/").
new_current_folder The new folder the current folder should be changed to (absolute, e.g. "/UserData/MyMusic/Ringtones/".
create Flag indicating if the folder should be created if it doesn't exist yet.

Implements ObexFtpServer.
